1 
 2                   XML toolkit from the GNOME project
 3 
 4 Full documentation is available on-line at
 5     http://xmlsoft.org/
 6 
 7 This code is released under the MIT Licence see the Copyright file.
 8 
 9 To build on an Unixised setup:
10    ./configure ; make ; make install
11    if the ./configure file does not exist, run ./autogen.sh instead.
12 To build on Windows:
13    see instructions on win32/Readme.txt
14 
15 To assert build quality:
16    on an Unixised setup:
17       run make tests
18    otherwise:
19        There is 3 standalone tools runtest.c runsuite.c testapi.c, which
20        should compile as part of the build or as any application would.
21        Launch them from this directory to get results, runtest checks 
22        the proper functionning of libxml2 main APIs while testapi does
23        a full coverage check. Report failures to the list.
24 
25 To report bugs, follow the instructions at: 
26   http://xmlsoft.org/bugs.html
27 
28 A mailing-list xml@gnome.org is available, to subscribe:
29     http://mail.gnome.org/mailman/listinfo/xml
30 
31 The list archive is at:
32     http://mail.gnome.org/archives/xml/
33 
34 All technical answers asked privately will be automatically answered on
35 the list and archived for public access unless privacy is explicitly
36 required and justified.
37 
38 Daniel Veillard
39
